meanings.definition: To surpass in gnawing or chewing.
meanings.sent1: The beaver outgnaws the squirrel when it comes to chewing through wood.
meanings.sent2: The termite colony outgnaws all other insects in their ability to chew through wooden structures.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse thought it could outgnaw the big rat in a chewing contest.
meanings.sent4: The relentless waves outgnawed the rocks along the shore, slowly eroding them away.
meanings.sent5: The hungry puppy outgnaws all his siblings when it comes to chewing on toys.

meanings.definition: To consume or wear away by gnawing.
meanings.sent1: The hungry squirrel outgnaws the acorns in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The rust on the old car slowly outgnaws the metal, causing it to deteriorate.
meanings.sent3: The beaver's constant gnawing outgnaws the patience of the other animals in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The relentless wind outgnaws at the edges of the wooden fence, slowly breaking it down.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillars outgnaw the leaves on the tree, leaving behind only bare branches.

meanings.definition: To defeat or overcome by gnawing.
meanings.sent1: The champion beaver outgnaws all competitors in the annual gnawing contest.
meanings.sent2: The relentless ants outgnaw the picnic-goers, leaving no food behind.
meanings.sent3: The clever mouse outgnaws the trap set by the farmer, enjoying the cheese without consequences.
meanings.sent4: The persistent erosion outgnaws the stability of the cliff, causing a landslide.
meanings.sent5: The determined beaver outgnaws the tree, bringing it down with a loud crash.
